title: (x) 'Garden State' movie logo - Interstate {Lex}
content:
Can anyone tell me the font used on the cover of the DVD of the movie 'Garden State'? Thanks.

[http://www.zach-braff.com/images/dvdside-gs.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031100913/http:/www.zach-braff.com/images/dvdside-gs.jpg "http://www.zach-braff.com/images/dvdside-gs.jpg")
author: copperfont

comments.content: Anyone else think Natalie Portman looks like Judy Garland, circa Wizard of Oz, in that photo?
Yeah, little bit. Did you know she got a nose job.. Whatashame. Beautiful like she was. Now it's all flat, artificial looking.

I thought she was beautiful in _The Professional_. No wonder Leon loved her.  
----------------------------------------  
Yes, I'm old, but so was Jean Reno!
That was such an amazing film. I am still in awe.

\> she got a nose job

Just goes to show that looks and brains are rarely found in the same person. The human consciousness cannot fully design [for] something "natural". As I pointed out in my Typo#13 article, the human nose is extremely complex\*. And then they want us to believe they've actually nailed down the act of reading, which involves the retina, perception, and cognition. It's funny/sad how quickly hubris tends to verge on plain old idiocy. Reality is to Modernism what Katrina is to the Mistral.

\* [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/health/4133093.stm](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031100913/http:/news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/health/4133093.stm "http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/health/4133093.stm")

\> The Professional

Yes, a superb work.

hhp

The Professional

French work; don't forget that.

- - - - - - - - - - - -  
Adjective5™ | Adj5™
Plus the latest Star Wars movie. She was in that, too.
